app.title: Move and track waste in the UK
app.phaseBanner: This is a new service - your <link>feedback</link> will help us improve it.

404.title: Page not found
404.paragraph1: If you typed the web address, check it is correct.
404.paragraph2: If you pasted the web address, check you copied the entire address.

multiplesError.title: Sorry, there is a problem with the service
multiplesError.paragraphTwo: If you have uploaded your CSV file, you will need to upload it again.
multiplesError.paragraphThreeTwo: if you need to speak with someone about your account.

startPage.title: Sign into your Defra waste tracking service account
startPage.description: If you move waste in the UK, or export Annex VII waste outside the UK, sign into your waste tracking account to create your digital waste records and manage all your records from one place.

serviceFeatures.description: You can use this service to:
serviceFeatures.listElementOne: enter the details of a UK waste movement for hazardous or non-hazardous waste, or an Annex VII record
serviceFeatures.listElementTwo: update any estimates you may have entered – for example, collection date, first carrier or waste quantity
serviceFeatures.listElementThree: download and print an Annex VII record to include with a green list waste export, using information you’ve provided
serviceFeatures.listElementFour: download and print waste movement records for UK waste movements, using information you’ve provided

beforeYouStart.title: Before you start
beforeYouStart.descriptionOne: Before you can use the waste tracking service, you must:
beforeYouStart.listElementOne: Sign in or create a Government Gateway account for your business or organisation if you do not have one yet. Do not use a Government Gateway account created to access your personal information.
beforeYouStart.listElementTwo: Sign in or register for a business or organisation Defra account using this Government Gateway ID if you do not have one yet.
beforeYouStart.descriptionTwo: Because you're registering on behalf of a business or organisation, you'll also need:
beforeYouStart.unorderedListElementOne: the main contact details for your business or organisation (for example, head office contact details)
beforeYouStart.unorderedListElementTwo: the Companies House number if the business or organisation is a limited company
beforeYouStart.insetText: The first account that you create for your business or organisation will automatically be an ‘admin account’. This account can be used to create andapprove additional admin or standard accounts within the same business or organisation.
beforeYouStart.descriptionThree: You can set up these accounts when you select ‘Start now’.
beforeYouStart.descriptionFour: If you’re an agent acting on behalf of an exporter, you must register for the waste tracking service using your own business details.

wasteMovementControls.title: Check UK waste movement controls
wasteMovementControls.description: If you plan to move waste inside the UK, you must report this before the waste is picked up by the first carrier.

exportImportControls.title: Check export and import controls
exportImportControls.descriptionOne: If you plan to export waste from the UK, you must report this in advance, before the waste is picked up by the first carrier. You’ll be able to update estimates to actuals later.
exportImportControls.descriptionTwo: Check the regulatory controls that apply when you:
exportImportControls.linkOne: export waste from or import waste to England
exportImportControls.linkTwo: export waste from or import waste to Scotland
exportImportControls.linkThree: export waste from or import waste to Wales
exportImportControls.linkFour: export waste from or import waste to Northern Ireland

getHelpTechnicalIssue.title: Get help with a technical issue
getHelpTechnicalIssue.descriptionOne: You can contact the move and track waste service support team if you need help with a technical issue, such as problems accessing the service.
getHelpTechnicalIssue.descriptionTwo: The move and track waste service support team will not be able to answer regulatory questions.

getHelpRegulatoryIssue.title: Get help with a regulatory issue
getHelpRegulatoryIssue.descriptionOne: If you need help from a regulator to complete waste movement or export notifications, you can contact your relevant national regulatory team. They will not be able to answer technical questions about service problems.
getHelpRegulatoryIssue.descriptionTwo: For additional regulatory guidance, you can also visit:
getHelpRegulatoryIssue.linkOne: For additional regulatory guidance, you can also visit:
getHelpRegulatoryIssue.linkTwo: SEPA (Scottish Environment protection Agency) waste information
getHelpRegulatoryIssue.linkThree: DEARA ( Department of Agriculture, Environment and Rural Affairs) waste policy tracker

breadcrumbs.current: Move and track waste in the UK

serviceChargeBanner.one: You have limited access to this service.

serviceChargeRenewalBanner.text: You need to pay the service charge by {date} to keep full access to the waste tracking service.

homePage.title: Move and track waste in the UK
homePage.name: {name}
homePage.cardLink: Create a new multiple waste movement

newWasteMovements.title: New waste movements
newWasteMovements.description: Create a single waste movement, upload a CSV file of multiple movements, or continue a draft waste movement.
newWasteMovements.allMovementsLinkAbsent: There are no created waste movements yet.

form.headingOne: Give feedback on the move waste in the UK service

rating.heading: Overall, how did you feel about the service you received today?

textArea.heading: How could we improve this service?
textArea.hint: Do not include any business or personal information here, for example reference numbers or names.

successPage.backLink: Go back to the page you were looking at
successPage.backLinkNewWindow: Return to the move waste in the UK service

errorPage.heading: Sorry, there is a problem with the feedback service
errorPage.paragraphTwo: If you have entered any answers, you will need to enter them again.
errorPage.backLink: Go back to the page you were looking at
errorPage.backLinkNewWindow: Return to the move waste in the UK service

breadcrumbs.ukwmHome: Move and track waste in the UK

page.headingOne: Correct errors and upload the amended file
page.paragraphOne: These are formatting errors that the system has identified. It cannot check for factual errors you might make when entering any details.
page.paragraphTwo: You can upload your amended file after correcting any errors a row at a time, or you can correct all errors in the whole file and upload it and the end.

errors.csvValidationError: The CSV file has errors in it. Check your file for errors

totalErrorsSummary.heading: You have a total of { totalErrorCount } errors
totalErrorsSummary.prompt: You need to correct these errors before you can create all your new waste movement records

instructions.paragraphOne: You need to correct all errors in your file and upload it again. This will replace your previous upload
instructions.linkText: how to create multiple new waste movements using the CSV template (opens in new tab)
instructions.paragraphTwoTwo: to understand how to fill it in

createAndUpload.heading: How to create and upload your file
createAndUpload.listItemOneLink: how to create multiple new waste movements using the CSV template (opens in new tab)
createAndUpload.listItemOnePartTwo: to help you create your file.
createAndUpload.listItemTwoLink: multiple new waste movements CSV template
createAndUpload.listItemTwoPartTwo: and open it using spreadsheet software. For example, Excel, Numbers, OpenOffice Calc or Google Sheets.
createAndUpload.listItemThree: Enter all the required information into the template.
createAndUpload.listItemFour: Save the file in CSV format.

documents.heading: Documents
documents.linkOne: How to create multiple new waste movements using the CSV template (opens in new tab)
documents.templateHeading: Multiple new waste movements CSV template
documents.templateDescription: This file may not be suitable for users of assistive technology.
documents.templateLink: Download the multiple new waste movements CSV template (3Kb)

uploadForm.heading: Upload your CSV file
uploadForm.hint: You need to review and check for errors before uploading
uploadForm.exceedsFileSizeError: Upload a file less than 15 MB

success.heading: You have no errors in your {count} waste movement {count, plural, =1 {record} other {records}} and can now create them all.
success.headingAfterCorrection: You have corrected all your errors and can now create {count} new waste movement {count, plural, =1 {record} other {records}}.
success.pageHeading: Create {count} new waste movement {count, plural, =1 {record} other {records}}
success.warning: You'll need to update all estimated details in your records with actual details as soon as possible after submitting.
success.body: If you cancel creating these now, you will have to upload the CSV file again.

confirmation.bodyP1: Now you have created these waste movements, you need to notify other involved parties of any relevant movements.
confirmation.bullet1: view all these created waste movement records (opens in new tab)
confirmation.bullet2: download a CSV file of these created waste movement records
confirmation.bodyP3: The receivers of the waste will need to confirm collection and receipt of the waste using the waste tracking service.
confirmation.button: Return to move waste in the UK

interruption.heading: Use the guidance to create multiple new waste movements using a CSV template
interruption.paragraphOne: When you enter your waste movement information into the template, you need to save it as a CSV file. This is where data is separated by commas rather than columns. If you change the structure of the template, your upload may fail.
interruption.paragraphTwo: It is important you use the guidance to help you fill in and upload the template correctly.
interruption.link: How to create multiple new waste movements using the CSV template (opens in new tab)

breadCrumbs.moveWaste: Move and track waste in the UK

collectionDate.title: Collection Date
collectionDate.hint: The date the waste was collected from the producer

ewcCode.title: EWC Code
ewcCode.hint: Search for any EWC code in your waste movements

wasteMovementId.title: Waste Movement ID
wasteMovementId.hint: Search for a waste movement ID

cancel.heading: You have not created your new waste movement records yet
cancel.paragraph: If you cancel creating these records now, you will have to upload the CSV file again.

guidancePage.heading: Waste movements in the UK: how to create multiple waste movements using a CSV file
guidancePage.hint: Use this guidance to help you complete a CSV template to upload multiple waste movements for the ‘Move waste in the UK’ service.

content.linkSix: European Waste Catalogue (EWC) codes and description

details.heading: Details
details.content: Use this CSV template and guidance if you want to submit multiple waste movements at the same time to the {serviceURL}. This is instead of submitting one waste movement record at a time.
details.listInfo: It’s important the information you enter is:
details.outro: Make sure you check for errors before you upload your file.

multiple.heading: Multiple waste movements CSV template
multiple.contentOne: You need to fill in the CSV template with information you would usually provide when you complete a waste movement record.
multiple.contentTwo: The template is designed so that it is accessible for most users and is compatible with as many programs as possible. For example, it does not include colours, freeze panes or pre-populated dropdowns, as these features do not work on all systems.

technicalIssue.heading: Get help with technical issues
technicalIssue.contentOne: You can contact the waste tracking service support team if you need help with a technical issue, such as:
technicalIssue.listItemOne: problems with uploading waste movement details using a CSV file
technicalIssue.contentTwo: You can contact the waste tracking service support team by emailing

regulatoryIssue.heading: Get help with regulatory issues
regulatoryIssue.contentOne: The waste tracking service support team will not be able to answer regulatory questions. You should contact your relevant regulatory team instead.
regulatoryIssue.contentTwo: Your national regulatory team will not be able to answer technical questions about service problems.

guidancePageCSV.heading: Creating multiple UK waste movements: how to create a CSV file for multiple waste movements
guidancePageCSV.hint: How green list waste exporters need to complete the CSV template for multiple waste movements.
guidancePageCSV.contentOne: Use this guidance to help you complete the CSV template to upload multiple records at a time.
guidancePageCSV.contentTwo: If there are any sections or questions that do not apply to your movement, leave the cell blank. You must complete all compulsory sections for all your records, which includes:
guidancePageCSV.listItemTwo: producer (person or business who has created the waste) details
guidancePageCSV.listItemThree: all relevant European Waste Catalogue (EWC) codes and descriptions of waste
guidancePageCSV.listItemFour: receiver (consignee-person or business who receives the waste for recovery or disposal) details

uniqueReference.heading: Your unique reference
uniqueReference.contentOne: You need to use a unique reference for each new record you submit.
uniqueReference.contentTwo: Your unique reference can be anything that helps you to identify your movement. For example, it could match a reference on a system you already use to identify movements.
uniqueReference.contentThree: Your unique reference can only have numbers and letters and should be a maximum of 20 characters. For example, ABC10001.
uniqueReference.contentFour: Make sure your unique reference is different for each movement. Each row on the CSV template is a unique movement. For example, if you put ABC10001 in one row, then you might put ABC10002 in the next to show it is different.

producerAndCollectionDetails.heading: Producer and collection details
producerAndCollectionDetails.headingProducer: Producer (person who creates the waste) details
producerAndCollectionDetails.contentProducer: The producer is also known as the person who organises the movement . This section must be completed in full.

tableProducerDetails.producer: Producer (person who creates the waste) details
tableProducerDetails.organisationDescription: Enter the full organisation name of the waste producer.
tableProducerDetails.addressDescription: Enter as much of the business address as you can.
tableProducerDetails.contactEmailDescription: Enter the email address in the correct format. For example,
tableProducerDetails.contactPhoneDescription: This should be a 15-digit phone number, including the area code, for example 01484 545612. Do not use any other special characters.
tableProducerDetails.sitCodeDescriptionOne: This is a 5 digit number used to identify different type of activities businesses do. You can
tableProducerDetails.sitCodeLink: search the Companies House register (opens in new tab)

tableCollectionDetails.collection: Collection (where and who is picking up the waste) details
tableCollectionDetails.isProducerAddressSame: Is producer address same as waste collection address?
tableCollectionDetails.isProducerAddressSameDescription: Enter ‘Y’ if the addresses are the same. Enter ‘n’ if the waste collection address is different to the producer address.
tableCollectionDetails.collectionAddress: Waste collection address if different to producer address
tableCollectionDetails.collectionAddressDescription: Enter as much of the address as you can.
tableCollectionDetails.collectionPostcode: Waste collection postcode if different to producer address
tableCollectionDetails.collectionPostcodeDescription: Enter the postcode in the correct format. For example, OX3 8BA.
tableCollectionDetails.wasteSourceDescription: Enter if the waste source is ‘household’, ‘commercial’, or ‘industrial’.
tableCollectionDetails.brokerRegistrationNumberDescription: This starts with CB and is followed by 5 or 6 digits. This is optional.
tableCollectionDetails.carrierRegistrationNumberDescription: This starts with CB and is followed by 5 or 6 digits.
tableCollectionDetails.modeOfTransportDescription: Enter if the waste is travelling by one of the following:

receiverDetails.heading: Receiver (consignee) details
receiverDetails.description: The waste receiver is the person or business who receives the waste for recovery or disposal.
receiverDetails.contentDescriptionOne: This is a combination of letters and numbers and is 8 characters long, for example AB1234CD. You can
receiverDetails.contentLinkOne: search for environmental permit numbers here (opens in new tab)
receiverDetails.contentDescriptionTwo: This is a combination of 3 letters, followed by 6 numbers, for example, ABC123456. You can
receiverDetails.contentLinkTwo: search for waste exemption numbers here (opens in new tab)
receiverDetails.contentDescriptionThree: This date must be in the future. Only use numbers and slashes between the day, month and year. For example, 23 /10/24 .
receiverDetails.contentHeadingFour: Number and type of transportation containers
receiverDetails.contentDescriptionFour: Enter a short description of the number and type of transportation containers, up to 100 characters long. For example, ‘3  yellow bin bags and 1 gas bottle’.
receiverDetails.contentDescriptionFive: Enter a short description of any special handling requirements if you are moving hazardous waste, up to 100 characters long. For example, ‘Goggles and cut resistant gloves are required’.

ewcCodesAndDescription.heading: European Waste Catalogue (EWC) codes and description
ewcCodesAndDescription.contentTwo: that are relevant to your shipment in the relevant columns in the template. You can enter up to 3 EWC codes with all their relevant details.
ewcCodesAndDescription.contentThree: If you add an EWC code, you must complete all the additional information related to that EWC code.

codes.heading: European Waste Catalogue (EWC) codes
codes.content: This should be 6 digits. For example, 010101.

descriptionOfTheWaste.contentOne: Enter the usual description of the waste . For example, ‘baled PET bottles, bagged HDPE pellets or OCC paper.
descriptionOfTheWaste.contentTwo: Your description must be 100 characters or less.
descriptionOfTheWaste.contentThree: Enter the physical form of the waste. This can be one of the following:

wasteQuantityDetails.heading: Waste quantity details
wasteQuantityDetails.wasteQuantityDescription: Enter the waste quantity using only numbers and a decimal point, for example ‘13.5’. Do not write the unit after the number. Do not include the weight of the container or vehicle.
wasteQuantityDetails.wasteQuantityUnitsDescription: Enter if the quantity is being measured in tonnes, kilograms, litres, or cubic metres.

descriptionOfTheWaste.contentFour: Enter ‘yes’ if the waste contains hazardous properties. You can
descriptionOfTheWaste.contentLink: find more information about hazardous waste here (opens in new tab)
descriptionOfTheWaste.headingFive: Does the waste contain Persistent Organic Pollutants (POPs )?
descriptionOfTheWaste.contentFive: Enter ‘yes’ if the waste contains POPs. There is
descriptionOfTheWaste.contentLinkTwo: additional information about POPs (opens in new tab)
descriptionOfTheWaste.contentFiveFinal: here, if you need further help.

uniqueReference.caption: Create a waste movement
uniqueReference.title: What is your unique reference for this waste movement?
uniqueReference.description: Your unique reference can be anything that helps you to identify your movement. For example, it could match a reference on a system you already use.

allowed.text: This can be a maximum of 20 characters, and can include:

prompt.caption: Producer and waste collection details

prompt.paragraphOne: The waste collection address is where the waste carrier will pick up the waste from.
prompt.radioOne: Yes, I want to use this address for the waste collection
prompt.radioTwo: No, I want to enter a different address for the waste collection
prompt.validationError: Select yes if the waste collection address is the same as the producer address

search.intro: This is where the waste needs to be collected from.
